Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2012 03:46PM NurseLeeLee wrote: Ugh, day 3 to 8 is awful.  Feels like the flu.  I have a prescription for reflux meds but just haven't taken it.  I'm such a weenie when it comes to putting anything else in my body right now.  lol.  I have anti nausea meds but have yet to take those, I know, I know...dumb. Trying to "tough it out" isn't working for me. My Dr. told me on my last visit, "stop trying to be superwoman".  I think I'm going to med-up next treatment.  I hate the general malaise feeling, yuk.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed in November, have questions! NurseLeeLee Melrosemelrose

Posts.Content: NurseLeeLee wrote: Still getting used to the diagnosis of "breast cancer".  Just saying the word chemo makes me nauseated. Taking my 3rd treatment on the 18th.  I have several questions: 1.  How long does each chemo tx keep you down? 2.  Do you receive Nuelasta after each treatment? 3.  Anyone have side effects such as reflux or other stomach issues? 4.  Did you change your diet once you began chemo?  If so, how? Believe, Trust, Live. Dx 10/9/2012, IDC, 4cm, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 11/2/2012 AC Chemotherapy 1/2/2013 Taxol (paclitaxel) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Diagnosed in November, have questions! NurseLeeLee Melrosemelrose
